{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is confirmed to be pregnant and has decided to medically abort her 6-week pregnancy. Tamoxifen is used in the treatment of breast cancer and Terbutaline is used to delay premature labor. A Copper intrauterine device is a form of birth control. Mifepristone is a medication typically used in combination with misoprostol to bring about an abortion during pregnancy. This combination is more than 95% effective during the first 50 days of pregnancy. Therefore, Mifepristone is the correct choice.", "answer_choice": "C"}
